p: Candida spp. are commensal versatile microorganisms that colonize up to 70% of dental prosthesis users. However, local or systemic alterations might cause an imbalance in the host, predisposing the host to the development of disease, which might range from superficial and localized involvement to a fatal condition when it disseminates across the body of immunocompromised individuals [ 1]. The oral manifestations of the disease are considered signs indicative of an immune response imbalance, particularly among patients with acquired immunodeficiency syndrome [ 2].
